links.*: Letter to Misses E. Jones and J. Taylor
Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien

wikitext.*:
[[File:Misses E. Jones and J. Taylor 20 October 1958.jpg|thumb]]
On [[13 January]] [[1960]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] sent a ''[[wikipedia:procuration|per procuration]]'' '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|letter]] to Elizabeth Jones'''. The letter was typed and signed by his secretary Elizabeth Lumsden.<ref name=Sothebys>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.sothebys.com/en/auctions/ecatalogue/2013/english-literature-history-l13404/lot.380.lotnum.html|articlename=ENGLISH LITERATURE, HISTORY, CHILDREN'S BOOKS & ILLUSTRATIONS 10 JULY 2013 (lot 380)|dated=|website=[http://www.sothebys.com/ Sothebys.com]|accessed=30 June 2013}}</ref>

* '''Description:''' 1 page, small 8vo.<ref name=Sothebys/>

==From the auction==

{{Blockquote|[The letter conatains a] printed statement about ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' and a typed paragraph stating that he is "working on a new book which I hope will tell you some of the things you would like to know."|<ref name=Sothebys/>}}
